comments: Javier doesn\'t take his students into consideration, he was my advisor and never informed me how much his class as well as the other art classes would cost me out of pocket. His only advice to me was drop his class when I presented him with my concerns. He\'s very bland when it comes to his responses to his students.

Javier did not make expectations clear in this mandatory GRAD Art History class. No idea what he was looking for on paper or essays. Very boring, read from notes during lectures, monotone. Might be great painting instructor but not good with art history.
Javier is very helpful and honest. He gives great advice for aspiring artists. I recommend him.

One of the best teachers I have had here at GSU. He is considered a mentor to me because about students moving forward. He has a very remarkable background in the art program. He is well liked by his students because his students enjoy his class and listening to him. I can honestly say that he wants his students to be successful.
